text: The 1946 Denver Pioneers football team was an American football team that represented the University of Denver in the Mountain States Conference (MSC) during the 1946 college football season. In its sixth season under head coach Cac Hubbard, the team compiled a 5–5–1 record (4–1–1 against MSC opponents), won the conference championship, lost to Hardin–Simmons in the 1947 Alamo Bowl, and was outscored by a total of 182 to 179. ==Schedule== ==References== Denver Category:Denver Pioneers football seasons Category:Mountain States Conference football champion seasons Denver Pioneers football
title: 1946 Denver Pioneers football team
